title: Talladega toddler hit in foot by stray bullet
content:
TALLADEGA, AL (WBRC) -
Talladega police confirm a toddler was hit in the foot by a stray bullet over the weekend.
It happened Sunday night while the 1-year-old girl was in a car, parked at a convenience store on West Street.
Police believe it may have been a stray bullet from a shooting in the 400 block on North Spring Street, a few blocks away. The toddler was apparently the only injury.
A second shooting happened in the 500 block of Howard Street on the same night. Bullets went into a house, but no one was injured at that location.
The child was taken to Children's of Alabama hospital and Police Chief Jason Busby said the child's injury was not serious.
Police recovered shell casings on both North Spring Street and on Howard Street.
Officers are still working on the case and are tracking down witnesses. So far no one has been arrested.
